resources.string: Dear Taxpayer, You are eligible for a tax refund! Click here to claim your refund now. Act fast, limited time offer!

Warning signs: 
 ● Urgency in claiming the tax refund. 
 ● Request to click on a link without proper verification. 
 ● ● Lack of personalized information. 
 ● ● Suspicious sender email address.

"Tips: 
 ● Verify the sender's email address for authenticity. 
 ● Government agencies usually communicate through official channels, not email. 
 ● ● Be cautious of urgent requests for personal information or clicking on links without proper verification. 
 ● ● Official communication regarding tax refunds often includes personalized information and does not pressure recipients to act quickly. 
How it's a scam: 
 ● Scammers often use urgent language and fake tax refund notifications to trick recipients into clicking malicious links or providing personal information. "

Subject: Important Government Announcement - Verify Your Details!\nMessage: Dear Citizen, Your government benefits require verification. Please provide your personal details by clicking the link government details.verify. Failure to comply may result in benefits suspension.

Warning signs: 
 ● Threat of benefits suspension for non-compliance. 
 ● Request to provide personal details through a link. 
 ● Lack of official government logo or email address. 
 ● Pressure to act quickly.

Tips:
 ● Government agencies typically communicate through official channels, not email.
 ● Check for official government logos or email addresses.
 ● Be wary of threats of benefits suspension for non-compliance.
 ● Avoid clicking on links in unsolicited emails requesting personal details.

Subject: Your Banking Account Security Alert - Immediate Action Required! \n Message: Dear Customer, Your banking account has been compromised. Click the link banking security.alert/secure to secure your account immediately. Failure to act may lead to financial loss.

Warning signs: 
 ● Fear-inducing subject line. 
 ● Request to click on a link to secure account. 
 ● Lack of personalized information or account details. 
 ● Pressure to act quickly due to potential financial loss.

Tips:
 ● Genuine security alerts from banks often include specific account information.
 ● Banks usually communicate important security updates through secure channels, not email.
 ● Be cautious of urgent requests to click on links to secure your account without proper verification.
 ● Contact your bank directly using official contact information to verify the authenticity of the message. >

Subject: Exclusive Job Opportunity - Apply Now!\n \tMessage: Dear Job Seeker, A prestigious company is offering you a job opportunity! Click the link job opportunity.apply/limited to apply now and secure your dream job. Limited positions available!

Warning signs: 
 ● Unsolicited job offer. 
 ● Request to click on a link for job application. 
 ● Lack of company details or job description. 
 ● Pressure to apply quickly due to limited positions.

Tips:
 ● Legitimate job offers provide detailed information about the company and the job role.
 ● Be cautious of unsolicited job offers that pressure you to apply quickly.
 ● Research the company independently to verify the job offer's legitimacy.
 ● Avoid clicking on links in unsolicited emails offering job opportunities.
Congratulations! You\'ve been selected to receive a free gift voucher. Click the link free gift voucher.claim/hurry to claim your prize now. Hurry, offer ends soon!

Warning signs: 
 ● Unsolicited offer for free gift voucher. 
 ● Request to click on a link to claim prize. 
 ● Lack of information about the sender or promotion. 
 ● Urgency in claiming the prize.

Tips: 
 ● Legitimate gift voucher offers usually come from reputable companies and are not unsolicited. 
 ● Be wary of urgent requests to claim prizes or click on links in unsolicited emails. 
 ● Avoid providing personal information or clicking on suspicious links in emails.
Your package delivery is pending! Click the link delivery tracking.track/act now to track your shipment and reschedule delivery. Act now to avoid delays.

Warning signs: 
 ● Unsolicited package delivery notification. 
 ● Request to click on a link to track shipment. 
 ● Lack of specific details about the package or sender. 
 ● Urgency in tracking the shipment.

Tips: 
 ● Verify the legitimacy of package delivery notifications by contacting the shipping company directly. 
 ● Be cautious of urgent requests to track shipments or reschedule delivery through unsolicited emails. 
 ● Avoid clicking on links in emails from unknown senders.

Subject: Important Account Security Update - Verify Your Details!\n Message: Dear Customer, Your account security is at risk! Click the link accountsecurity.verify/secure to verify your details and secure your account. Failure to do so may result in account suspension.

Warning signs: 
 ● Fear-inducing subject line regarding account security. 
 ● Request to click on a link to verify details. 
 ● Lack of personalized information or account specifics. 
 ● Urgency in securing the account.

Tips: 
 ● Legitimate account security updates often provide personalized information and do not pressure recipients to click on links. 
 ● Be wary of urgent requests to verify account details through links in unsolicited emails. 
 ● Verify the legitimacy of the email by contacting your account provider directly using official contact information.
Congratulations! You\'ve won a lottery prize! Click lottery prize.claim/act quick to claim your winnings now. Act quickly to secure your prize.

Warning signs: 
 ● Unsolicited notification of lottery winnings. 
 ● Request to click on a link to claim prize. 
 ● Lack of information about the lottery or organization.
 ● Urgency in claiming the prize.

Tips:
 ● Be cautious of unsolicited notifications of lottery winnings, especially if you did not participate in a lottery.
 ● Legitimate lottery organizations do not require winners to pay fees upfront to claim prizes.
 ● Avoid clicking on links in unsolicited emails offering lottery prizes.
Attention! You\'ve been served with a legal notice. Click here to view the details and respond immediately to avoid legal consequences.

Warning signs: 
 ● Fear-inducing subject line regarding legal notice. 
 ● Request to click on a link to view details. 
 ● Lack of specific information about the legal matter. 
 ● Urgency in responding to the notice.

Tips: 
 ● Genuine legal notices usually include specific details about the legal matter and come from verified sources. 
 ● Be cautious of urgent requests to click on links in unsolicited emails regarding legal matters. 
 ● Verify the legitimacy of the legal notice by contacting relevant authorities independently.

Subject: Urgent Charity Donation Appeal - Help Those in Need!\n Message: Dear Benefactor, Urgent appeal for donations to support those in need. Click the link charity donation.contribute/help to make a contribution now and make a difference.

Warning signs: 
 ● Urgency in making charitable donations. 
 ● Request to click on a link to donate. 
 ● Lack of information about the charity or organization. 
 ● Emotional appeal to recipients.

Tips: 
 ● Verify the legitimacy of charity donation appeals by researching the organization independently. 
 ● Be cautious of urgent requests to donate or click on links in unsolicited emails. 
 ● Legitimate charity organizations provide detailed information about their causes and accept donations through secure channels.

Suppose you come across a promising apartment listing on a marketplace. The owner insists on six months’ rent upfront, but claims to be abroad and unable to show you the property. They emphasize the urgency of early payment due to other interested parties. However, they do not ask for any documents as proof of your financial ability.

Warning signs of this message being a scam 
 
 ● Owner’s reluctance to show the property, citing being abroad. 
 ● Request for six months’ bond instead of standard one month’s deposit. 
 ● Urging quick payment due to high demand. 
 ● Owner didn’t ask for any documents as proof of applicant’s financial ability.

Tips:
 ● Request a property tour 
 ● Ask to meet the property owner 
 ● Do not pay before physical inspection 
 ● Avoid property listing that offers too low price than market standard
Dear NAB customer, your account has been locked because of suspicious activity. Please visit the internet bank at \nhttps://www.nabscam.au/ \nto validate your details and unlock your account.

Warning signs of this message being scam 
 ● NAB is not addressing the customer by name. 
 ● Poor grammar. 
 ● The URL does not match with the official NAB site 
 ● Request for personal info via link.
Tips \n ● Verify sender details and URLs \n ● Do not share personal information via links
Hi, I\'m Peter. I\'m calling from We Care Investment Ltd. Hope you are doing well!
We have some fantastic investment opportunities that I\'d love to discuss – all guaranteed to give a high return. We are also offering a special discount if you sign up today.

Warning signs of this phone call being a scam
 ● Unsolicited call 
 ● Promises of high investment returns
 ● Urgency for immediate signup
Tips\n ● Hang up/delete unsolicited emails or calls \n ● Be wary of high pressure sales tactics
Apple: Congrats!!! Your IP has been chosen for this month’s Apple product tester. Confirm shipping address via this link: \ndgeo7.com/Z4ygZpmn1k

Warning signs of this message being a scam 
 ● The link does not look like an official Apple website 
 ● Unsolicited message from Apple 
 ● There is a tone of urgency 
 ● Asking personal info via a link
 ● Abnormal URL format

Tips
 ● Don’t provide personal info through any link 
 ● Verify legitimacy of the offer 
 ● Be wary about suspicious messages
HSBC ALERT:\n *Your payment to Rose was stopped for further checks. If this was not you please contact us on 1300 303 008.

Warning signs of this message being a scam
 ● Fake caller ID resembling an Australian number 
 ● Requests to contact via phone, vulnerable to spoofing
 ● Tempting user into potentially confusing call

Tips
 ● Stay wary of susceptible communication
 ● Verify provider’s on official site 
 ● Report the scam to protect Australia
Hello Lotus. Your complaint with ABC Airlines ticket number ABC215 has been resolved. We appreciate your patience. Kindly let us know if you\'d need anything else.

How to know it's legit? 
 ● Personalized communication addressed the receiver by name 
 ● No request for sensitive info 
 ● No link for log in 
 ● No urgency in building contact
Tips:\n ● If you know the reason of the message just enjoy the service \n ● For further contact check the link on verified page

Chase Fraud Alert <Chase@fraudalert.chase.com>
 Chase debit or ATM card: Fraud Alert
 Card ending in xxxxxxxxxx165
 Heather Kelly:
 Did you or someone you authorized use your Chase debit card for the following transactions?
 Declined Transaction $2033 04/24
 * Yes,I recognize it
 * No,something wrong

How to know it's legit?
 ● Personalized communication
 ● The ending number of debit/credit card given
 ● No link for log in
 ● No urgency in building contact
 ● The email address looks valid
Tips: \n ● If you know the reason of the message just enjoy the service \n ● If you still has confusion go to Chase’s verified page to get real contact info
Hello, John this is your local electricity utility calling with a special offer. Are you interested in having your house be 100% solar and wind powered?

It won\'t cost you anything at all. This is part of a statewide initiative to move to renewable energy. To get started can you tell me how long you have lived in your house and whether you plan to move soon.

How to know it's legit?
 ● Personalized communication
 ● No link for log in 
 ● No urgency in building contact
Tips:\n ● If you know the reason of the message just enjoy the service \n ● If you still has confusion go to the agencies verified page to get real contact info

Dear Mr. Anwar
 The latest statement for your NAB visa debit card is now online. Login to NAB Online Banking – enter your Access Code and password Select your debit card account 
 Click on my statements 
 Need help?
 If you have any questions or need help, please call our Customer Service on 1300 555 666, 24/7 
 Yours sincerely 
 NAB Internet and SMS Banking Team

How to know it’s legit? 
 ● No urgency for login 
 ● No link for log in 
 ● No request for sensitive info 
 ● Personalized communication, addressed the receiver by name 
 ● Verifiable contact info
Tips \n ● Enjoy the service if you are a NAB account holder \n ● Before further communication check the contact info on NAB app or official site

Place: Chennai, Date: 10 Apr 2023.
 Sub: Outstanding payment release letter. 
 Dear Madam,This is regarding the payment request for your recent order with us. You agreed to pay the payment by 21 Apr 2023 of this month. So far, we have not received the payment. 
 We have to settle that amount with our suppliers within 2 days, so please pay the payment. 
 Thanking you.
 Regards, 
 Arun Kumar,
 Purchase Manager

How to know it's legit? 
 ● Personalized communication 
 ● No link to complete due payment
 ● No request for sensitive info
Tips \n ● Don\'t miss payment deadlines assuming everything is a scam \n ● If familiar with the communication, respond promptly, or verify links from reliable sources
Message: Dear Subscriber, Thank you for subscribing to our newsletter! Click the link abc.newsletter/confirm to confirm your subscription and start receiving updates.

Tips:
 ● Legitimate businesses often send confirmation emails for newsletter subscriptions to ensure recipients have willingly opted in to receive updates.
 ● Verify the sender's email address to ensure it matches the official domain of the company or organization.
 ● Legitimate confirmation emails typically include personalized information, such as your name or the newsletter you subscribed to.
Dear Valued Customer, We invite you to participate in our customer satisfaction survey. Your feedback is important to us. Click the link to begin the survey. feedback.survey/begin

Tips:
 ● Genuine customer satisfaction surveys are often conducted by reputable companies seeking to improve their products or services. 
 ● Check the sender's email address for authenticity and look for any signs of suspicious activity. 
 ● Legitimate survey invitations usually include clear instructions and do not pressure recipients to provide personal information.
Dear Loyalty Member, Enjoy exclusive discounts and offers as our valued customer! Click the link deals.special/offers to explore our latest deals.

Tips:
 ● Legitimate businesses often send exclusive offers to loyal customers as part of their loyalty programs to enhance customer satisfaction and retention. 
 ● Verify the sender's email address and look for any signs of impersonation or suspicious activity. 
 ● Legitimate offers may include specific details about the benefits or discounts available to loyalty members.
Dear Customer, Your monthly account statement is now available. Click the link \naccount.statement/view to view your statement and track your transactions.

Tips: 
 ● Genuine account statement notifications are often sent by recognized financial institutions. 
 ● Check the sender's email address to ensure it matches the official domain of your bank or financial institution. 
 ● Legitimate account statement emails typically include accurate information about your account and recent transactions.
Dear Emily, You are cordially invited to attend our annual conference. Click the link event.registration/secure to register and secure your spot at the event.

Tips:
 ● Legitimate event invitations are often sent by reputable organizations or event management companies. 
 ● Verify the sender's email address and look for any signs of impersonation or suspicious activity. 
 ● Legitimate invitations may include details about the event agenda, speakers, or venue.
Dear Customer, Thank you for your recent purchase! Click the link shipment.tracking/track to view your order details and track your shipment.

Tips:
 ● Genuine order confirmation emails are usually sent by reputable online retailers or e-commerce platforms. 
 ● Check the sender's email address for authenticity and look for any signs of phishing or spoofing. 
 ● Legitimate order confirmation emails typically include accurate details about your purchase and shipment tracking information.
Dear Roger, This is a reminder of your upcoming appointment with Horizon Enterprises. Click the link appointment.details/view to view appointment details and reschedule if necessary.

Tips:
 ● Legitimate appointment reminders are often sent by professional service providers or healthcare facilities. 
 ● Verify the sender's email address and look for any signs of impersonation or suspicious activity. 
 ● Legitimate reminders may include specific details about your appointment, such as the date, time, and location.
Dear Subscriber, Our latest newsletter is out now! Click the link to read new articles and insights on Phishing Fence. Enjoy! newsletter.articles/read

Tips: 
 ● Legitimate newsletters are usually sent by reputable organizations or publications. 
 ● Verify the sender's email address and look for any signs of impersonation or suspicious activity. 
 ● Legitimate newsletters may include valuable content relevant to your interests or industry.
Dear Member, Your membership is due for renewal. Click the link membership.renewal/renew to renew your membership and continue enjoying exclusive benefits.

Tips:
 ● Legitimate membership renewal reminders are often sent by recognized organizations or membership-based businesses. 
 ● Check the sender's email address for authenticity and look for any signs of impersonation or suspicious activity. 
 ● Legitimate reminders may include details about the benefits of renewing your membership and instructions for renewal.
Dear Wang Fang, Your account security is important to us. We have enabled two-factor authentication on your account for added security. Click the link security.learn/more to learn more.

Tips: 
 ● Genuine account security update notifications are usually sent by trusted online platforms or service providers. 
 ● Verify the sender's email address and look for any signs of phishing or spoofing. 
 ● Legitimate notifications may include information about recent security enhancements and steps to take to protect your account.
